results.title: Flax
results.brief_description: Opens with scenes of the flax industry in pre-war Ireland. With the outbreak of war, Britain’s supply of European flax was cut off. The film shows various improvements adopted to increase the production of flax in Britain, including the use of machines to pull the fibre and also the use of material in the unretted state.

results.title: Flawless
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joel Schumacher and Jane Rosenthal
results.brief_description: Gruff, homophobic, retired security guard Walt Koontz (Robert De Niro) has, what he considers to be, the unlucky fortune of living opposite flamboyant drag queen Rusty Zimmerman (Philip Seymour Hoffman). However, after suffering a debilitating stroke in a fatality involving Rusty’s friend Amber, a tenuous link is formed between them. On advice from his physical therapist Walt asks Rusty for singing lessons to improve his speech - the constant taunting between them also helps the vocal chords. They slowly become involved in one another’s personal lives, if only playing out who faces the worst adversity and trotting off predictable homophobic and heterophobic comments. The subplot involving the retrieval of the stolen money that Amber lost her life for provides the film’s climax which is littered throughout with the usual tenets one expects from Joel Schumacher (slow-mo, image distortion), with a passing nod to “As good as it gets” in its intolerable male come good scenario, and a touch of humour. Cast also includes: Barry Miller, Daphne Rubin-Vega, Wanda de Jesus.

results.title: Flatworms: platyhelminthes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 3. Animal life”.
After brief views of land, fresh water, marine and parasitic flatworms, shows the important characteristics of the common planaria. These are the simplest animals with bilateral symmetry, a distinct head, a central nervous system and a substantially developed mesoderm layer. Their regenerative ability is demonstrated, showing polarity, the anterior-posterior gradient and cell dominance.

results.title: Flatliners
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Stonebridge Entertainment, Michael Douglas, Rick Bieber and Joel Schumacher
results.brief_description: A group of medical students are determined to experience the afterlife by putting themselves in a near-death state and reviving themselves at the last minute. To literally “flatline”, shut down their hearts, just for a short time, to experience what it would be like to die. Problems arise when one of the students, Nelson Wright (Kiefer Sutherland), becomes obsessed with death and is determined to experience the afterlife before being revived. The screenplay was written by Peter Filardi who wrote the plot after hearing of a friend’s own near-death experience during an operation. ‘Flatliners’ was one of the most popular films of the early 90’s and was the first dramatic lead role for Julia Roberts. Cast also includes Kevin Bacon, Oliver Platt and William Baldwin.

results.title: Flatland
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, Harvard University and Edwin Abbot
results.brief_description: An animated mathematical allegory by Edwin Abbot about a square who discovers the third dimension, but is jailed by the two-dimensional inhabitants of Flatland when he preaches multidimensionality. Also offers a universal social commentary on social structures and values. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Flat
results.brief_description: Carried out in a 2D reality, repetitive motions mirror the mechanical patterns in modern society. In this one-shot abstracted sequence, abscuring motion and direction, repeated gestures move beyond meaning and into compulsive necessity. Detail magnifies while reason fades.

results.title: Flashpoint
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Don Worobey and Ernie Schmidt
results.brief_description: An animated interpretation of the Pacific Ocean ablaze as a result of a collision between two giant supertankers. The film explains that there is no technology available to cope with such a disaster, and in a realistic, animated way it is a reminder of the dangers of tanker traffic in coastal waters. The stunning animation method used in this short film is similar to Japanese ‘Manga’ style. Although this film deals with serious issues surrounding environmental disasters, it manages to introduce some comic moments that simultaneously educate and entertain. Story by Ian Slater. Animation by Ernie Schmidt.

results.title: Flashdance
results.creator_credit: PolyGram, Paramount Pictures, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Adrian Lyne
results.brief_description: Flashdance is the story of Alex Owens, a fiercely determined 18 year old who is a Pittsburgh steel-mill welder by day, and a bar dancer by night. We follow her struggle to gain independence, find love, and to realise her dream for a career in modern dance. Includes music by Giorgio Moroder. Cast includes Jennifer Beals, Michael Nouri, Lilia Skala, Sunny Johnson and Kyle Heffner.
